name: Instant Pot® Creme Brulee
author: Susan
summary: A simple classic dessert that is quick to prepare in the Instant Pot®.
ingredients: 3 teaspoons white sugar, or more to taste
directions: Place a trivet in a multi-functional pressure cooker (such as Instant Pot®); add 1 cup water
Heat heavy cream in the microwave until very hot, but not boiling, about 45 seconds
Whisk egg yolks, 2 1/2 tablespoons sugar, vanilla, and salt together in a mixing bowl
Add 2 tablespoons of the warm cream and whisk quickly
Slowly add in the remaining cream, stirring well
Pour the mixture into three 6-ounce ramekins
Cover ramekins with foil and place on the trivet, stacking if necessary
Select high pressure according to manufacturer's instructions; set timer for 8 minutes
Allow 10 to 15 minutes for pressure to build
Release pressure using the natural-release method according to manufacturer's instructions, about 5 minutes
Check custard; it should jiggle around the edges but not be liquid; it will set up more as it cools
Let cool to room temperature, 15 to 30 minutes
Top each custard with 1 teaspoon sugar
Heat sugar with a kitchen torch until caramelized, about 30 seconds
